snippet: Interviews with survivors helped clear a cloud of confusion around the humanitarian disaster, which, if confirmed, would be the largest in Europe’s migrant crisis in a year.
abstract: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees reports 500 people may have died in Mediterranean after boat packed with migrants from Middle East and Africa capsized; if count, based on survior interviews, is confirmed, drownings would be worst humanitarian catastrophe in European migrant crisis since 800 died in 2014 off coast of Italy.

byline.contributor: Jim Yardley contributed reporting from Rome, and Nour Youssef and Declan Walsh from Egypt.

lead_paragraph: Interviews with survivors helped clear a cloud of confusion around the humanitarian disaster, which, if confirmed, would be the largest in Europe’s migrant crisis in a year.

headline.main: 500 Migrants May Have Died in Sinking of Boat in Mediterranean, U.N. Says

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
